msContents.summary: Receipt for the Memphis harbor tax paid by persons leaving the Fayum.

msItemStruct.note: Text is on one side only, 11 lines written with the fibers. Text mentions the locations of Memphis and Bakchias.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 4.0 x 5.2cm. Partially preserved list, margins regular in shape but incomplete on all sides. Lines 9 and lower are badly preserved. Possibly a short centered 11th line is missing due to a hole; lines 8-end are in a different hand.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1898-9) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1901, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: "Ninnas has paid [the tax] for the harbor of Memphis at the gate of Bakchias, exporting four artabas of dates on one ass, in the ninth year of Traianus Hadrianus the lord, on the fourteenth of Epeiph. Signed by Leo[ ], in the ninth year on the fourteenth of Epeiph." (A. Fandl)

listBibl.bibl: P. Fay. 174 P.Customs 132a John R. Abercrombie, "The University Museum's Collection of Papyri and Related Materials," Expedition 20.2 (Winter 1978): 32-37. Sijpesteijn, P.J. Customs Duties in Graeco-Roman Egypt (Zutphen: Terra, 1987), P.Customs 132a with transcription.
